intro: Sida arsiniata, commonly known as the Indian mallow or desert mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils or in disturbed areas. Sida arsiniata is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
